title: Fantastic support
body:
I recently had a open abdominal myomectomy and they consultants that completed the surgery were fantastic and followed me up on the ward days after the surgery 
The staff on the gynaecology inpatient ward were the most loveliest and compassionate professionals I have had the opportunity to meet Nothing was too much and they were very supportive during my recovery

title: Great care and treatment
body: I was admitted as an emergency surgery patient for a serious ankle fracture. A&E / ortho on call teams were excellent, compassionate and highly competent. I can’t thank you all enough.

title: Good helpful consultation
body: Pharmacy sorted out my new prescription quickly and promptly. Friendly and helpful which was very much appreciated

title: Neurophysiology -  Autistic patient superb care.
body: I received exemplary, first class care and support throughout my appointment process with Neurophysiology at Queens. All reasonable adjustments were considered and provided and the staff from the clinic admin team to the Dr and nurse who undertook my nerve conduction studies explained things clearly as they went along but without being overbearing and treating me like a baby due to a lack of awareness of autism. They communicated clearly and effectively and provided care and support which was befitting of genuine caring health professionals during the Nerve Conduction Studies process. More often than not, the National Health Service get communication and care of people with autistic spectrum conditions horrifically wrong; however, at Queens today and during email communications prior to today, they led the way of how appropriately and sensitively interacting with, dealing with and providing treatment for a patient with some minor needs should be done. I have a neurologist appointment here in September and I am hoping for similar. Thanks to all staff at neurofizz today!

title: Compassionate service
body:
I’m not a patient here, but one of my employees is. She came into work today in a really bad way, and with her permission I rang for a GP appointment. 
The receptionist answered very quickly, she was very compassionate and professional, and offered an appointment within a couple of hours. 
My team member was incredibly grateful to the practice and now has a plan to get herself better again thanks to the fantastic GP she saw.
Really well done Fryern for seeing the human behind the patient.

title: Excellent service
body: Went to healthshare clinic, Norwich for a pelvic ultrasound and it went so well. Had a really pleasant experience, the staff were quite polite and I didn't have to wait even a minute beyond my appointment. Was able to leave so much earlier than anticipated. There's absolutely not even a single thing I can't think to complain about.

title: Caring and supportive team
body:
Excellent staff, I had a “meltdown” recently whilst at the surgery, the nurse supported and signposted me to get the right care, the receptionist checked I was ok. 
Thank you!

title: Great practice
body: Very friendly staff that went above and beyond to fit me in for an emergency appointment. Did not have to wait for more than 3 minutes in the waiting room. Excellent service & care

title: Job well done
body: The doctor (ER) was clear, very pleasant and very assured. She understood my problem and gave apposite advice about moisturiser and the ointment. This has proved (2 days later) to provided an excellent course to a good resolution to the issue. Thank you.

title: Greatest practice
body: I am very happy with  this gp service all the time we need they give appointment even during the pandemic they help us  alot I highly recommend this Gp sargery and  even if we need emergency appointment  they try their level best to give the appointment for kids so i am so happy with the service even if we need any help they help us alot

title: Always helpful
body: The Staff and Doctors are always so helpful and caring even with simple problems. Nothing is ever to much trouble and the staff always follow up your question and get back to you. Great practice.

title: Very helpful
body: Helpful and friendly individual. Information she provided was brilliant. She was a big help and gave me lots of support and tips on how to manage. In conclusion, she was a lovely person.

title: Great Practice
body: Contact procedure is very easy to use and they reply quickly. Very caring, open and easy to talk to and can go back to them if unsure of anything. Self and two other family members use this service and would recommend.

title: Great practise great staff
body: The practice have quick phone call response the staff are so helpful n polite always try their upmost to find a solution when on many occasions iv had to change an appointment the staff iv seen have always been polite caring and just overall a gd experience everytime iv needed medical help or advice

title: Excellent practice.
body: Tudor Practice is a great practice and they are always striving to do the best for their patients. The doctors that I have dealt with are always kind and understanding. I cannot speak highly enough of this practice. 5 stars.

title: A lovely caring practice
body:
I can always get an urgent appointment when need and a routine appointment with days. My GP/nurse's are friendly and put you at ease, are well informed, empathic, and actively listen to what you say. 
All said this is a great practice with great staff. I could not wish to be under better care for my (late) husband and myself.
Keep up the good work.

title: Great hospital
body: Thank you to everyone who was involved in getting me well enough enabling me to make it home. Nothing was too much trouble, a very caring hospital.

title: Highly professional nurses
body:
Twice now, I have had Tamworth nurses out of hours, and I live in Lichfield.
Unbelievably professional.....unlike where I am based.
Messages get sent, and not 'lost'.
Truly magnificent work and mannerisms.
Thank you girls..

title: Great practice
body: Not long joined this practice, approx 2 months, what a refreshing change to belong to a practice who cares about their patients despite being incredibly busy, from reception staff to the drs, their website is terrific, can’t fault them, they have restored my faith in a gp service thank you

title: Great Service
body:
I have been experiencing some symptoms which I associated with a medication that I have been taking - so, I emailed the practice. I was contacted quite quickly after by a very knowledgeable member of staff. She discussed the symptoms, appreciated my concerns and explained the options available to me. We agreed on a plan and I’m really happy with what has been agreed.
I cannot complain about this Gp / Patient interaction

title: Great practice
body: Courteous, friendly and very efficient - we are very happy with our NHS service and hope that it continues with what they provide- we are always contacted to remind us of repeat injections and health needs.  Don’t change please it works beautifully and thank you.

title: Exemplary care
body: I was sent by my GP for further tests, only waited 2 minutes in the waiting room before being moved to a treatment area where I was well looked after over 7 hours while they did various tests. The doctors and nurses are very caring and attentive and made what was a slightly traumatic experience feel much better.

title: Very caring and reassuring.
body: Recent visits to the surgery about my health were met with an early appointment, followed by a detailed session with the doctor.  Various tests were called for and carried out quickly by very kind staff.  The results were later discussed with me over the phone, allowing me the way to proceed.  As an elderly person, worrying about my health, I now feel reassured that all is being done to help me.

title: Great practice
body: Excellent service start to finish, receptionist very helpful, saw the practice nurse for injections who was excellent

title: Excellent service
body: Tried the new appointment booking system.  I am so impressed! I received a phone call within 1 hour and treatment the same day. Excellent care.

title: Fab
body: Was really worried about going but the nurses were so lovely one was holding my hand through procedure ,doctor was brillant explained everything ,didnt have long to wait  would recommend this clinic 1st class ,well done everyone

title: Grate practice
body: Very friendly and polite stuff, always happy to help, the best GP I’ve ever had, staff  care about the patience, and providing the best of the knowledge service.

title: Very friendly staff and overall great experience
body: I recently visited my local GP surgery, and I must say that my overall experience was quite positive. From the moment I walked through the doors, I felt a sense of warmth and professionalism that put me at ease. The waiting area was clean and well-maintained, with comfortable seating and a relaxed atmosphere. Despite the clinic being busy, the wait time was surprisingly short, which was a pleasant surprise. Overall, my recent experience with my GP surgery was positive and left me feeling confident in the care I received.

title: Compassionate care
body:
My partner suffers from Alzheimer’s and he has stayed here twice for respite care. I was very anxious leaving him in an unfamiliar environment and initially he did not want to stay. The staff were incredibly kind and highly skilled, winning his confidence and trust and encouraging him to stay. The care my partner received from every member of staff throughout each stay has been outstanding . He refers to them as his friends and looks forward to seeing them again. Apparently the food was good too - better than my efforts at home .
Thank you Ireland Lodge for your thoughtful and compassionate care in what must be challenging circumstances at times.

title: Exceptional practice
body:
Support care and compassion given by the doctors and staff at this surgery is exceptional. 
This really is a shining example of how GP surgeries should be run.
After recently losing my dad, the staff and doctors at the surgery went above and beyond to make sure Dad was as comfortable as he could be calling us out of hours and even making prescriptions out at the weekend so we could pick them up as an emergency. Calling the hospital when he was admitted to give them as much information as they could.
And calling us after Dad had passed to pass on my condolences and make sure that we were okay and coping as best as we could.

title: Excellent care
body: The Doctor was very caring explained my symptoms and the treatment and tests that I'm to receive. I felt relieved that I was getting help. Couldn't ask for more.

title: Good all round practice.
body: I have always found the surgery response very good. The Doctor’s and nurses are very helpful and have always helped with my health care. The receptionist service is also kind and clear. Considering the amount of people who want appointments.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: Huge thanks to the surgeon, theatre staff, anesthetist, Gara ward staff, nurses and auxiliary staff at the hospital. Whole experience was professional, caring and swift. Really couldn't have asked for more

title: Go above and beyond
body: From the Doctor that I had a telephone consultation with regarding my daughter, to the staff on reception, a great big thank you to you all for always being so friendly, approachable, knowledgeable and professional. I appreciate and thank you all again for always "going above and beyond to help"

title: Excellent practice
body: Receptionists listened and my request for an urgent appointment was dealt with on the same day followed by a referral.

title: Fast & efficient
body: Visited urgent treatment, professional manner from all staff. Felt valued & heard throughout. Excellent care given. Clean and friendly environment. This is a credit to South Holland.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Great service
body: Well looked after by staff excellent care by the clinic staff explained everything to me and felt comfortable with what was going to happen

title: Very Impressed
body: Recently transferred to this practice due to never being able to get appointment at my old practice and I'm pleased I did. Staff helpful and friendly with a smile. Highly recommend

title: Professional service
body: Both ladies put me at ease immediately. Talked me through everything .I felt in very safe hands .Would not hesitate to use this service again .

title: CT Scan
body: I attended on 14 July for a CT scan of my bowel. All of the staff that dealt with me ere first class! They were friendly, caring and extremely professional. I feel privileged to have had such caring treatment

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent clinical review
body:
Thanks to the gynaecologist and his team for a thorough examination and clear explanation of my mother’s problems. 
Felt reassured that her symptoms had been sympathetically reviewed and options discussed.

title: Scan delight
body: The appoint was on time. The staff were friendly and ensured that I was comfortable.  Everything was explained to me and was executed well. Very  happy with the service.

title: Great experience
body: I used eConsult initially for a semi urgent problem. It took minimal time to complete the questionnaire and then within two hours I was sent a text with a face to face appointment for the next day. I receptionist then also called to make sure I had been allocated the appointment. The GP I saw was lovely and empathetic and examined me and completed my referral very quickly. I was really satisfied with the experience, thank you.

title: Great service and treatment
body: My 3rd visit to this hospital, on each occasion it was very professional service and treatment from very pleasant medical staff.

title: Reassuring experience
body:
Attended outpatient appointment.  Very welcoming receptionist.
Called before my actual booked time.  Examined and assured everything was okay but to refer back to my GP to be referred back if I had any worries or problems in future.  Very efficient, friendly and reassuring consultation.  Thank you Worthing Hospital.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: Once you can get through to the practice, the staff were always very polite and helpful.  Additional information by text was sent promptly.  The staff took the time to explain next steps.

title: Great Practice
body: Had a very quick service today. Went in on the of chance of being seen and the receptionist was really nice and welcoming. I was advised of a short wait time and that they would be happy to see me. When I was called the nurse was honest and caring and was able to offer advice in terms of my query.

author: Squirrel watcher
title: Feeling rough for a couple of days
body:
Day 1 Phoned Cowes clinic 10:00. On hold for 10 mins, then gave my symptoms. At 12.30 I was phoned by doctor who said come to clinic for blood & urine samples. Did that at 1:30.  
Day 2 - at 8.15 get call from same doctor. Results are in, I have an infection, & a prescription has been sent to Day Lewis. Collect antibiotics at 10:00 & start the course just 24 hours after first contact.  
Appointment made for 4:00pm Day 4. Confirmed diverticulitis. Finish antibiotics.  
Day 16 blood tests show everything is fine.  
Many thanks for a fast and efficient service.

author: yellowkr45
title: Many many thanks to the staff
body:
Very very nice clinic. I go here twice a week. I suffer with leg ulcers so I go to the leg ulcer clinic-I have been going for two and half year. I have got to know everyone and everyone is very nice.  
  
Many many thanks to the staff at Manor Park.

author: brandyann
title: Made the whole experience a pleasure
body:
My elderly father had to have an urgent blood test at Penryn Surgery at 09:00 on the same day as his appointment at 14:20 for an eye injection at Treliske.  
Whilst on the way to Treliske, the surgery phoned to advise another blood test would be required as something was omitted, so we agreed to go back to Penryn surgery at 16:00.  
When we arrived at Treliske and explained the appointment to Shaun and Christine it became apparent it would not be possible to make it.  
I asked Shaun and Christine if they could help and they offered to do the blood test. I contacted the nurse at the surgery, handed my phone to Shaun, the arrangements were made and the blood test was done.  
I must also say a very big thank you to Dr Ali, who very kindly waited for me have a conversation with the surgery nurse whilst he was treating my father and explaining everything to us.  
Shaun, Christine and Dr Ali are excellent ambassadors for the NHS.  
They were so kind and caring and great fun to be with!  
They took time explaining everything to my father and made the whole experience a pleasure.  
Christine was also very kind to my father on his previous appointment in June.  
Please ensure they have the recognition they deserve! They are valuable people!

author: janesian
title: Care and Compassion
body:
My GP surgery has become a vital link to my health, which has deteriorated over the past year.  
At all times, Dr Khan listens with care and understanding. A recent visit needed a blood test. It was completed within 24 hours of seeing the GP and a visit to Park House the next morning was greeted by lovely staff and a warm welcome.  
I was offered another blood test as my GP took the time to follow this up with my neurologist due to a symptom that needed further advice.  
The lovely Linda, a phlebotomist at Park House, did the next test, and the results were negative.  
Unfortunately, my health took a dip when problems with my Epilepsy re-appeared plus new symptoms. I was lucky enough to get an MRI scan due to Dr Khan being vigilant and thorough. He asked me and my partner the right questions to determine how the changes were affecting me and my quality of life.  
I am waiting for the results of this scan but I wanted to say thank you to Dr Khan, and all the staff who work at Unity. They are a credit to the NHS and deserved to be thanked publicly for the huge contribution they make and the difference they make to me.  
Thank you all.

author: Christine63451
title: Being well looked after by a student nurse and staff in Lisnaskea health centre
body: Over this last week I've had to have a few bloods done I visited Lisnaskea health centre . There was a student nurse training I asked the nurse in charge Alison would the student nurse like to take my blood as that's how they learn. I also warned her my blood was hard to get. Amy the student nurse got my blood the very first time. I'd like to say how confident this young nurse was and is an asset to the treatment room with all the other good nurses in there. Thank you Amy for making my visit so easy for me.

author: Pauline O
title: Health check for my daughter
body:
I saw Emma at the Heaton Norris health centre for my daughter's check up  
I had a great experience.  
Emma was lovely with my daughter and made her feel very comfortable. Lots of toys and a play mat were ready when we arrived, in order to do the assessment. My daughter had lots of fun. We didn’t feel like we had to rush, Emma took all the time that was needed to explain things and made sure that we could properly assess all parts of the questionnaire. She also asked us questions and seemed interested in knowing us a little bit more which was nice.

author: octansnf74
title: End of the working day help
body:
My mother is in her eigties had been suffering with severe constipation for 2 weeks without telling anyone. I visited her at 3:30pm and could see her distress. I Knew that I could never see or speak to a doctor at 3:30pm on a Friday, but was desperate so I phoned the GP for advice.  
Within 15 minutes Dr Bodel from Old Mill surgery Newtownards had called me back, not only prescribing medication to help the problem but also provided additional emergency medication should her condition deteriorate further over the weekend. His care and compassion proved to me this isn't just his profession but his life and dedication to patients. I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to such a wonderful doctor

author: Stephen825
title: Lovely experience
body: I had a small lump in my lumber area It was causing me concerns as it hurt when bending and sitting. I saw a GP at Hoxton, she was welcoming and asked me to explain my concerns. She examined me thoroughly whilst explaining what she was looking for. She didn't find that the lump was anything serious and reassured me I could carry on with any activities but did say she would get me to have an ultrasound on my lumber area just to be 100% sure. Lovely experience with this GP. I felt I was listened to and felt so relaxed.

author: vegabc76
title: Excellent service
body: Having been a patient for over 20 years, I have nothing but praise for this surgery, I’ve always found the reception staff and especially the doctors caring, and compassionate, when I hear other people complain, I just can’t relate to it, and out of the thousands of patients they have got, I can’t be the only one who is more than satisfied with the service, so I want to give the credit they are due.

author: Beechtree
title: He broke the news in such a compassionate, caring, and human way
body: My dad recently attended A and E with a head injury. Unfortunately he slipped in a coma during his visit due to a large brain bleed. The doctor called us to his bedside in the middle of the night. Dr Hepburn told us the news, in attendance with nurse Joanne who was lovely. Dr Hepburn had to break the news to our family that my dad was going to die. He broke the news in such a compassionate, caring, and human way, he just could not have worded it or acted any differently under the circumstances and we are grateful to all the staff who helped at A and E.

author: Woos mum
title: Boarding bed experience
body:
I was admitted to Treliske hospital with sepsis in March 2023 and once stabilised and recovering they needed my bed on the surgical ward I was on for someone else to I was moved to the urology ward late in the evening. On arrival I was informed that I was to be cared for with their boarding bed. This was a bed in a corridor. No privacy, no peace and in my opinion a very poor solution.  
The urology ward had many patients with UTIs which causes confusion and distress in some people and many of the these patients were wandering the corridor and refusing to be encouraged back to their bed by the overworked and understaffed nurses. This was an incredibly upsetting and awful experience that most certainly was not something that contributed to improving my wellbeing.  
I informed staff that I would go home and return in the morning for my IV antibiotic treatment and was told they would not be able to readmit me in the morning as I will have discharged myself from the care of the hospital. The idea that someone who is considered too unwell to leave but not sick enough to warrant a bed is bizarre.  
The nursing staff were exceptional and genuinely cared about their patients but in my opinion, they forced to work in such poor conditions with too few colleagues on a shift and then adding an extra bed into a corridor.

links.id: let down and very distressed at the time

author: A menopausal old lady
title: The staff were very supportive and friendly
body:
The staff were very supportive and friendly. Specifically, Dr Palmer and Fola and Val were brilliant.  
I was very nervous and anxious and they were supportive and friendly. They put me at ease and made an unpleasant experience more bearable.  
Dr Palmer was professional and calm when she discussed the results with me. She explained it in an easy manner that made it better for me to understand.

author: oscarjw44
title: A million thanks to all concerned
body:
I rang the doctor because I needed help getting in and out of bed and he decided I needed to be assessed by the Occupational Therapists. Recently someone contacted me, but it was too late, so they agreed to come in the morning.  
They arrived mid morning and they have been wonderful and most encouraging. I have Parkinson’s and spinal degeneration, so they watched me walk - they were very encouraging, and they said I was doing very well. It was very nice to hear them be so encouraging -I was a nurse myself so it was good to hear this from the professionals.  
They also saw that my chairs were a bit low, and they are going to arrange for me to borrow a chair and a gel cushion (which are like gold dust) and they are going to make sure I get one very soon. They have given me the address of two other places to get a chair and it’s helpful to know about this.  
We went through skin care, and they told me to be careful and not to let it slip. They left me feeling so happy and like someone bothered about me and that I wasn’t just on a tick list.  
A million thanks to all concerned.

links.id: i felt that i mattered and not just a number

author: Purple1006
title: Struggling to get to speak to GP
body:
For the past two weeks I have been trying to contact the surgery to ask for an x-ray referral as I can never get an appointment. It is 8.30 am. I tried, again, to ask reception a question, evidently they reached capacity. If there is a way to book a GP appointment on line I have yet to find it. This is appalling. We don't all have time to wait on the phone and the receptionist appears to decide whether I need to see a GP or not without passing my request through for the GP to decide.  
We are told not to go to A&E unless our problem is urgent. My problem is getting worse. I know my body. I need an x-ray. Looks like I will have to worry the overrun A&E department at Kingston Hospital.  
Is there no authority overseeing this surgery ? I feel the service just gets worse.  
I am angry and frustrated.  
Why is their time more important than mine?

author: danceps73
title: Waiting for an ultrasound scan
body:
I attended Omagh hospital radiology department for an ultrasound scan, because I had a pain in my stomach going up into my rib cage that made me feel sick at times. My GP who referred me because I’ve started losing weight. I spoke to my GP about it and I got a letter for the ultrasound two days later, which I thought was a very efficient service, very speedy. I couldn’t believe it was as fast, the doctor is really doing her job. My GP is based at GP Drumragh family practice within the Omagh health primary care complex. So I’m pleased with the GP but I am disappointed with the system with seeing people at their appointment times.  
My appointment was 9:00am and you had to check in at the reception desk. I handed my letter and was told to go down and wait in the correct waiting area, which I did. There was a man right behind me and he handed his letter over and when I was waiting. He arrived and waited too, his appointment was 9:00 am and so was mine. He was called in at 9:00 am, and I was first at reception so I thought I should have been called in first.  
Then another lady arrived with a bad knee and her appointment time was 9:15am. The fella came out and then the lady was called in, in front of me. Now, I am in my seventies with type 2 diabetes, I got to the loo quite frequently and I had to have 2 pints of water in the morning, as instructed on the letter for my ultrasound scan, so I excused myself to the nurse to say my appointment is at 9:00am. They said to hold on, saw the radiographer (or whatever their role is), then I was called in and the lady had to sit back down (with the bad knee).  
I said I didn't think it was a good system, people after me being called before me; they said there’s 2 clinics going on, but I think it doesn’t matter if there’s 2 clinics or 22; if you get there first you should get taken in first. How would you feel if that happened in the supermarket queue, someone going before you after they arrived after you? No matter how much money you put into the healthcare system it’s only as good as the staff in it. If I hadn’t spoken up for myself I might still be sitting there waiting.  
Because I had said I wasn’t happy about the waiting system, the radiographer said there are forms you can fill in, which is of no use to me, I’ll tell you why, I’d spend ten minutes filling it in and then I believe the person that receives the form will crumple it up and throw it in the bin. So that’s why I am calling Care Opinion instead.  
I don’t think that people should be called in before you if you arrived first.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: cyclonewn55
title: Left in pain
body:
I was on morphine for years I have chronic pain and I had to go to hospital for emergency and when I got out I had to deal with more pain complications. Instead of helping my doctor stopped my morphine overnight without telling me or a reduction or any advice. This had obviously affected me badly and for the life of me I can't understand why the doctor did this.  
I have suffered horrible pains and withdrawal symptoms all because of the reduction in my medication and the doctor not listening to me about my pain in the first place and ignoring any suggestions I make.  
This doctor has caused me loads of issues that I am still trying to fix now. I made a formal complaint.

author: Dr noHubbard1969
title: Ask my GP app
body:
How can 21st century GP appointments be so fraught with problems? I get up at 7:00am or so just to try make an appointment and it's closed. I get a questionnaire from the GP, but it's 15 questions long and I follow the link and it's not there. I feel the the receptionists are way above there station and not at all helpful when I want a gp appt .  
I go on the app after 20 mins of constantly being engaged - it could be hrs on a Monday - and am told I have to go on the ask my gp app and request an appointment. I put phone down only to find the quota for day is full and not taking anymore requests for day. Feeling slightly miffed, as you would be, I ring back and after another 20 mins or hours to speak to the receptionist who also now appears annoyed at my annoyed tone. So,next morning, I try again and so it continues.  
We don't ring GP's for a "How's your day" chat, it's normally due to being unwell, in pain etc. When you do get through there are no appointments or advice to go to a&e which normally involves all day sitting there. This was the case twice due to osteoarthritis in my neck and trapped nerves, causing excruciating pain and 7 hrs in A&E waiting for pain medication.  
I've spent 3 weeks in bed since Xmas,5 days or so at a time wishing I was dead in bed rather than sitting in A&E for hours, writhing around in agony where no position is even slightly comfortable. This is due to the GP insisting I cannot see a doctor due to there being no appts for the day.  
I'm in my fifties and quite good on Internet but "Ask my Gp" is beyond me unless it's a simple repeat prescription. I'm almost scared to ring due to the here we go again attitude from the receptionists.

links.id: staff able to connect with distressed patients

author: vegadn75
title: Ilkley Moor Medical Practice
body:
Booking system never updated with appointments. This then means that patients are not sent SMS messages with time and date of appointments so ends up being a DNA on GP system .  
I think that the surgery is not linked to the NHS website or Airedale Medical website . This means no information about anyone is shared, so I don't believe they are liaising with other medical departments within the area about people's medical history.  
I suffer from mental health conditions and physical health issues also and the GP at IMMP stated that they had never read my notes, nor did they take them on board as mental health issues are not something we deal with only proper physical health.  
They also made me aware that they don't look at discharge notes. I was told that they don't prove real illnesses.  
I believe this surgery needs looking into as I understood from a member of staff working there that they are not dealing with patients not paying.  
Does this mean if you are seriously ill then don't expect to get any tests done that cost?  
They charged me £30 out of my benefits for a letter to government to acknowledge I was ill. My whole food shop money for 2 weeks. The merge with Grassington seems financially motivated. Its now IG Medical Practice.  
I found this is a disgrace.

author: julycb93
title: Regaining ability to do everyday tasks after major emergency surgery
body: After discharge from hospital,I felt exhausted, falling asleep frequently. Gradually, with help & encouragement from the Stroke support team, I made good progress & am now able to resume my normal activities,whilst continuing with the exercises in the Giraffe programme. This support has greatly improved my outlook & wellbeing, for which I am extremely grateful.

author: Babz8991
title: 19 week anatomy scan
body: Had my anatomy scan today with Judith. First of all we had no waiting time at all, which was great. I was very nervous about the scan today but Judith made me feel very welcome, at ease and was reassuring. She spoke throughout explaining the different features of baby. We had a great experience. Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ulster2000
title: Good care at the Ulster hospital
body: I was involved in a RTC whilst using public transport and attended Ulster Hospital ED as a result. I was doing OK and waiting in the waiting area until I took a bad vomiting turn later in the evening. I was then taken into the cubicles beside the nurses station where I was looked after by a lovely nurse called Hari who went above and beyond and could not have done more for me. She is a credit to the Ulster Hospital and to the NHS. Well done.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: whiskeyzt46
title: A prompt efficient service
body:
I was called to Portadown HC for AAA screening. I attended 20 minutes early. I was seen within 5 minutes and called in for U/S a few later. Staff were pleasant and welcoming. They informed me fully about what was happening and the results immediately. They confirmed my GP would be informed. 

A helpful and professional encounter with the HSC unlike all I have had over the last few years.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Happy Quilter
title: Attending rheumatology dept
body: Had an appointment with the nurse today who took time to listen to my concerns. She explained things clearly to me and gave me support.

author: Cland93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Wonderful Care
body:
I have been in Female Medical in Daisy Hill Hospital for the past four days and in that time I have had such amazing care. Everyone has been wonderful and in particular the nursing staff they have been very kind, caring and made me feel very much at ease, even though at times I felt frightened of the unknown.  
I have been kept informed on a daily basis of my progress and what treatment I will need going forward, nothing is too much trouble for these ladies and they are a credit to the hospital.  
All tests and bloods have been done swiftly and without hesitation, I really have nothing negative to say about this ward or indeed hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: HappyClaire
title: Stoke Mandeville A&E were amazing
body:
My doctor sent me to Stoke Mandeville A&E this morning.  
I was quite upset and anxious before I went as had no one to come with me, but needn’t have been… every member of staff I interacted with over the course of the day were so friendly and lovely - more than you would expect just from someone doing their job.  
The staff in UTC immediately made me feel at ease, I was seen after about 15 minutes, and they also made me laugh with ‘awarding me the magic papers’ to move on to A&E.  
I was seen about five/six times for different things (like blood tests, examinations, CT scan) over the next four hours in A&E and every person I spoke to was really friendly, listened, interacted - and some also made some jokes, all helping to put me at ease. I even got blown a kiss goodbye and told to take care by the last person who was looking after me.  
I believe there was a junior doctors strike today from the news, but you really wouldn’t have known from the speed or amazingly friendly attitude by all of the staff ☺️

author: b47bod
title: Replacement knee surgery
body: Extremely pleased with the process from start to finish. From the pre assessment interview with Catherine and Michelle through to the discharge process with Dorna I was more than satisfied with the whole process. The interviews with Mr Keenan the surgeon and also with the anaesthetists made me feel confident and relaxed before the operation. The care and attention I received during my stay in the NTC was professional and attentive. I am confident the TKR will be a complete success due to the involvement of the entire team Well done NHS Scotland.

author: Jord91
title: Hospital visit
body: Some staff very rude, staff kept on loosing my documents and forgetting to write stuff done. I am also still awaiting results which apparently have been lost in Scunthorpe. One of the toilets was out of toilet roll for two days and there was a urine sample on the toilet floor for two days as well

author: Chris532
title: I am truly grateful for all the hard work
body: The AMSS ward was amazing and a credit to the hospital. The staff there were, helpful reassuring and friendly. They really looked after me. The wards and toilets were meticulously clean and well looked after. I am truly grateful for all the hard work that every person took to look after me during my stay from the porters and admin staff to the nurses and doctors.

author: JB007
title: Pausing of Therapy Soured Whole Experience
body:
I had been attending Adult Psychology for years, which I appreciate is significantly longer than most patients, which I acknowledge and am grateful for. I acknowledge that I wasn’t the easiest patient to work with due to how extremely strong my DP (Detached Protector) was, which included being very difficult to get me to open up, and subconsciously self-sabotaging the work. So, it took a while know what my goals for therapy were.  
Throughout the years the psychologist did mention that it may be necessary to pause therapy, which I initially interpreted as therapy ending and said as much the first or second time. The psychologist made it very clear that it would just be a pause and they would be happy to continue treating me.  
My main goal which was to tackle my feelings of defectiveness was retained, and when originally setting the goals, the psychologist suggested including reducing/removing the Detached Protector (DP), however the psychologist explained that in order to tackle my defectiveness it was necessary to remove the DP first which I accepted only on the understanding that my main goal was tackling feelings of defectiveness.  
As layers of the DP were removed, my feelings of defectiveness became more acute, my level of distress increased, which resulted in my psychologist recognising I needed hospital treatment of my physical health and to stay safe, which I myself didn’t recognise, so I appreciate their efforts in keeping safe. I'm not sure if improving distress tolerance was ever formally added as a therapy goal, but it did become part of the work, which I recognised as being necessary, and have no complaints about.  
As I did want my therapy to end (after completing the goals) rather than it being ongoing, I did regularly push to move onto tackling my defectiveness. The psychologist would say my detached side was still too strong, which I would accept until my feelings of defectiveness became more acute, in which case I would push to move onto tackling my defectiveness again, and again I would be told that I was still too detached.  
Then, in I believe in late-2021/early-2022, my psychologist made it clear that if I didn’t make progress that we would need to pause therapy, which I wasn’t happy about, but I could fully understand as it had been a number of years, and would be a better use of resources to work with someone they could make progress with, rather than continue with me and no progress. The required progress being that the detached protector was further reduced, and my distress tolerance improved.  
I achieved these goals in the Summer of 2022, and it was finally time to start tackling my defectiveness, week 1 of this I shared my third significant defect.  
Throughout the work on removing the detached protector, I shared a few minor defects, and three what I consider to be significant defects (at least the defects that cause me the most pain), unfortunate the experience of sharing the last two (at different times) significant defects were not a great experience.  
The first significant defect shared was overall a good experience, and did some work (I think either the same session I brought it up or at the next session as well), which helped but didn’t fully tackle the defectiveness, which I wasn’t expecting it to and I believed that we would return to this after we had finished reducing my DP, which I was fine with.  
The second significant defect shared resulted in not been tackled at all, and was a bad experience when I brought it, and when I persisted at the following session it was also a bad experience, but I appreciate in the follow-up case that was due to me misinterpreting the psychologist’s motivations/actions, but did result in being tackled at all.  
Third defect, the session I brought it up was a good experience, and psychologist did try to tackle it, but these weren’t landing, however I could see that they were trying, and I was optimistic that at the following session we would make progress and that the psychologist would be working with me as part of a team to tackle it.  
However, following that session, the psychologist decided to pull the plug and pause therapy, one reason given was that the psychologist was unable to see my emotions, and so thought I was still too detached. Another reason given was as the result of me deciding to be more fully open and honest with the psychologist, and as it was given as a reason to pause therapy, I feel as if it was used against me and I was punished for being more open and honest. The psychologist also highlighted that because I had been in therapy for a number of years that a gradual exit process would be required, which made sense.  
The not being able to see my emotions was due to these sessions having been via the Near Me sessions, and I believe this was subsequently shown to be the case.  
Following this, I was able to at least have a review meeting, where it was agreed that I would receive 6 sessions of using imagery to help tackle the defectiveness and then a further review, the success criteria for the review was not discussed. It feels like the intention was to always end after the 6 sessions, and that the 6 sessions were instead of my exit sessions. Throughout these 6 sessions and at the review sessions, the psychologist again made clear it would be a pausing of therapy.  
I was only given one exit session, and at this exit session for the first time the prospect was raised that therapy may not resume. Leading me to question if I can trust anything the psychologist has said over the years.  
I thought that I could reluctantly manage for another year of having reduced DP before resuming to tack my defectiveness, but I am finding it extremely challenging & difficult without support.  
[Unsure about 'Treatment']

author: hotelfw66
title: Treated with such kindness, compassion and good humour
body:
I brought my daughter in who was unwell. We were monitored for a period of time before being discharged.  
I just wanted to feed back how fantastic the team looking after her were - Nurse Emma, HCA Jon and Dr Tilly.  
My daughter has special needs and epilepsy and, despite the staff being busy, she was treated with such kindness, compassion and good humour, as was I!

author: CarRoo03
title: Thank you for the fantastic care of our relative
body: We would love to thank all of the staff working in the High Dependency Unit (HDU) for the fabulous care they provided for our sister/aunt before she was moved to medical High care. We really can't thank you all enough, especially Sinead for keeping us well informed about her care and how she was doing. Thank you again.

author: Stirling Resident
title: Treated respectfully, professionally & with genuine care
body:
Woke up by chest pains and advised by GP and 111 to go to A&E at Forth Valley Royal Hospital. I was triaged in 25 minutes and had an ECG and given pain relief. I was then taken to the Urgent Care Unit where I had several tests.  
At every stage of the process I was treated respectfully, professionally and with genuine care. I was told what was happening, the results of tests were explained clearly, and kept informed how long it would take for the next stage. I felt I was in good and safe hands.  
The entire experience brought home to me how we should be so grateful for our NHS, and in particular for the phenomenal people we have working in it.  
Thank you , FVRH!

author: Roger123
title: Getting an appointment
body:
Getting an appointment is a nightmare, I have called each morning for a week to try and get an appointment to no avail.  
The receptionist says just call again, How are patients meant to be seen!

author: equuleuses68
title: I like this clinic very much
body:
I want to say I am so happy to have this clinic. The nurses, Talisa and Natasha, are such nice women and many thanks for this appointment-they are very good workers.  
I like this clinic, thank you very much!

author: Hospital23
title: Extra care given to ensure she stayed warm
body:
My mother was admitted to this ward after becoming ill. She had previously had a stroke. She was initially placed on a side ward but after one night there was moved into main ward. There was no need space available for her in this ward so he bed was placed in a corner beside a door leading to an external balcony.  
There was a constant flow of cold air coming in the door even though it was closed. I spoke with the staff and was informed they had highlighted this earlier. My mother is in her late seventies and quickly after one night in this location had shown signs of a head cold.  
The nurse explained all needs where full and that they were trying to find a more suitable place for my mother.  
The nurse was extremely understanding to my concerns and as my mother had been receiving excellent care from them I felt more reassured that all was being done to sort the matter.  
Unfortunately a bed did not become available until the 3rd night but at this time my mother was being released.  
I can't thank the staff enough for the care they individually gave to my mother that resulted in me being able to bring her home.  
It saddens me to think that there were no other suitable beds available in the hospital for my mother and potentially someone else's facing a similar situation who's family member could end up with further health issues. It is difficult for the patient, family and nursing staff to have to accept this situation and I wish that more could be done to support those in the caring profession and those that need it to ensure they recover quickly and don't end up having additional issue.  
I would like to thank all the staff for their care of my mother, she is very special to us, and thanks to all of you and the extra care you gave her to ensure she stayed warm whilst she recovered we have gratefully for her home with us again.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Gill234
title: Our experience was of an excellent service
body:
Accompanied my father to Lagan Valley Urgent Care Centre following a fall resulting in a nasty ear injury. Dr Stanford and Dr Baker did a wonderful job suturing his injury, my father was treated with utmost respect and kindness.  
On return home he became unwell and was returned by ambulance to be reviewed. NIAS crew were amazing, so calm and kind, I’m disappointed I can’t recall the names of the two male paramedics who attended. Despite a long day in the department, our experience was of an excellent service.  
Thanks to all the nurses, Niamh, Lynda and Martin, to name a few and all the Healthcare Assistants, everyone was so kind and professional.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hydrasp83
title: Amazing service
body:
Amazing service never felt so comfortable in these kind of circumstance.  
Thanks so much to Denise and Tara.

author: aprilse43
title: This unit is an example to all care providers
body:
My Dad was taken into the Critical Care Unit (CCU) in July 2023 and sadly passed away a few days later. Although it was a short period of time, my brother and I spent most of those days with him.  
We met many of the CCU's care team during this time. I would just like to sincerely express our gratitude to each and every individual working in this unit. The care, respect and genuine warmth our family was given is something we will never forget. Thanks to them my dad maintained his dignity and his wishes were respected.  
This unit is an example to all care providers. There is a retiring collection for the CCU, following his service. Thank You,

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: Mammabear
title: Perfunctory assessment
body:
After an urgent referral to ENT for suspected acoustic neuroma was given a very perfunctory assessment by Consultant.  
The Consultant did not take a full medical history and focused on the slight one-sided. hearing loss, despite other symptoms being advised upon referral.  
Consultant advised they would like to do a telephone review rather than send a letter which as ENT found somewhat unhelpful and indeed rather illogical given speciality dealing in, one imagines, hearing loss.  
MRI with contrast ordered and blood tests for same. Blood tests undertaken locally at hub the following day but now discover that MRI referral is routine and will take up to 12 weeks which I further understand is out with protocol and indeed targets .

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been very good so far
body:
So far my care that I have been getting in 1 north has been very good so far. I really have no complaints about the way that I have been treated so far.  
The reason that I haven't had a complaint is the fact the staff have all been very good so far there's not a bad word I could say about any of them they have been great. They have also been easy enough to understand there's been no issues with their communication

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been pretty alright to be honest
body:
I am currently admitted into 1 north in the hospital and my care has been pretty alright to be honest. I couldn't complain about my treatment to be honest its really been good.  
The foods been alright so far too there's also been decent variety as well.  
The wards also been pretty clean couldn't really complain about it.  
The staff are brilliant too couldn't really complain at all about them. They have been lovely and I really have no issues at all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A brilliant level of care.
body:
I could not complain at all about the way I have been treated so far, the care has just been wonderful. I have been treated very good since I was admitted. The staff have been responsible for this as they have been so caring. They really couldn't do anything more for me as they have shown me a brilliant level of care.  
They're also really quite good with communicating I haven't any issues understanding them either

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Annmr74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Forever grateful for your dedicated care and kindness
body:
To all the staff of Ward 40,  
Thank you.We will be forever grateful for your dedicated care and kindness shown to our father during his stay on your ward during the weeks from June to July.You are all a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Inspotam
title: Thank you to the team
body:
My son was recently in to get some teeth out and I must say the experience was as positive as it could be for him.  
My son has sensory issues and was very anxious but the doctors listened to us and helped us to do what was best for my son. They clearly explained everything and never made us feel like anything was too much for them.  
Thank you to everyone for their support and genuine care for us.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Scott973
title: Crosshouse A and E
body:
Was told I would only be kept 3 hours as I have a bad back and the chairs the have u sitting on cripple me a went at three on the bus it was then 1030 at night, still hadn't had treatment. I was starving ma back was breaking because of their chairs. I was in agony a got concussion and a broken wrist.  
I still haven't had treatment there was a patient who fell out her chair and was on the ground rolling about screaming for hours before anyone done anything the staff just sat and watched a have never had a worse experience in ma life I'm literally in agony because of the time they had me sitting on them chairs. How am a meant to get home your an adult I was told that up to u no bother honestly, I found this a complete joke of a place. I don't believe they care. They told me it will be 3 hours, 7 hours later still hadn't had treatment and a had no way of getting home I use public transport.

author: Stunr93
title: Ninewells hospital A&E
body: Our toddler had a fall at nursery, resulted in a double fracture to his arm. The response from A&E at Ninewells was fantastic. Smooth and seamless from arrival to triage to treatment with follow up arranged. The staff were friendly, caring, responsive, attentive, funny and overall an absolute credit to the service. The interactions with our 3 year old put him at the centre of the care, lovely engagement keeping him involved in all steps of his assessment and casting. Explained everything to him first making him the priority and he felt involved from the start, made him the star of the show and put him at ease. Fiona the ANP, Alana who was the health care assistant and Nicola the charge nurse showed great person centred care, made us parents feel at ease by the care provided. Communication skills were second to none, talking and containing parents while engaging a 3yr old on a Friday night are sometimes skills we take for granted. Fantastic people providing fantastic care.

author: ASC Galvim
title: Swelling on the arm and pins and needles
body:
I had a painful small lump below my right elbow on Sunday. When I went to bed the lump was enlarged, red and hot. In the morning it was still large and hot and hot and I was getting pins and needles down my arm. I filled in the online form which said dial 111. I did not believe it was that serious since otherwise I was well.  
I called the surgery and they called back. A doctor called me late morning and I was given a 6pm appointment that day. I was given ibuprofen cream for the lump and told I probably had a trapped nerve. Three days later all is well

author: Fad
title: Professionalism all round
body:
Each visit or contact with the practice, always met with the highest professionalism, not once have I witnessed any conduct below.  
Doctors do listen and explain each issue to me clearly, always ready to help, from receptionist to all other medical personnel in the practice. Great service all round

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Could not complain about a single thing that I have seen
body: The care in 1 west has been really quite good i honestly could not complain about a single thing that i have seen. The food that i have gotten has been really quite great i haven't had an issue with it. Its the same with the whole ward though staff are lovely they couldn't do enough and have communicated wonderfully, its been pretty clean

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

There really so nice i couldn't ask for better at all. There just wonderful and so far i haven't had an issue communicating with them as there very clear and speak in a way that i understand. I haven't an issue at all with my care

body: 2 norths has been a pretty decent level of care i really couldn't complain at all. Sometimes its not the easiest to understand their technical terms but they do try their best. I haven't any major issues with the care and my experience of the ward
